p: The above-mentioned facts demonstrate that the key components of vulnerability—sensitivity and adaptive capacity, which are the components to which the poverty and socio-political organization indices are related–are the most important factors in need of improvement in order to reduce the vulnerability of the Amazonas population to future climate variability and change. Although the Amazon region has experienced increased frequency of extreme events over the last few decades, this was not reflected in higher exposure rates in the present study, possibly because the environmental aspect (vegetation cover index and deforestation) has helped to modulate the effects of disasters in the state.
